National Association of Educational Broadcasters
1340 CONNECTICUT AVENUE
WASHINGTON, 1). C. 20030
HAROLD E. HILL VICE PRESIDENT
January 22, 1965
Miss Marion Corwell
Associate Director
Dearborn Public Schools
4824 Lois
Dearborn, Michigan 48126
Dear Marion:
I haven’t reacted to the exchange of correspondence between you and
Lee Campion prior to now, because I thought Lee might drop into the
office early this week, as he indicated in his letter, and we could
then discuss the matter. Apparently, his schedule was too tight for
him to come by, so I’ll now write.
Bill Harley, Jim Fellows and I have discussed this project and think
the idea has merit and that Lee has proposed a simple way to proceed.
However, we have a couple of major reservations.
First, we wonder whether the use of the information would justify the
expense in printing the nice little booklet that would be required to
get the information out. Our thought is that it would not receive very
widespread use, because those most interested in speakers (PTA, school
boards, service clubs, AA.WU, etc.) are normally in a position to merely
pick up the phone and call a friend in the business or one who knows
someone who is.
Second, we are a little leary of giving the impression that we are
endorsing those whose names appear in the booklet. This might be
especially bad, if, as we fear, the ones wanting their names listed
tend to be actually the least qualified.
This doesn't close the door, obviously, but we did want you to know our
reactions.
Harold E. Hill
HEH/smj
cc: Mr. Lee Campion
